description.en:
(from amazon.jp):

This collection contains seven short manga and a series of short manga spreads, mainly from two medium-length serials that Katsuhiro Otomo made between 1979 and 1980, when he was 25-26 years old.

The title work, “G.....” which depicts the battles of former German mercenaries involved in the civil war in a small African country, has never been collected, but the four chapters (approx. 80p/unfinished) are finally included in this release. The depiction of ground battles and fighter planes in this work is breathtaking, and it is a powerful work filled with the same artistic and dramatic power as later works such as “My Feelings are Already War” and “AKIRA.

Also included are all four chapters of “The Saint Comes to Town” which depicts the uproar and miracles caused by the visit to Japan of a famous jazz band from the past, and “Otomo Katsuhiro's Nutritious Fullness” a series of parodies of children's stories that appeared in the music magazine “rockin'on” on a double-page spread. 

which was serialized in the music magazine “rockin'on” as a two-page spread.
The other short stories included are two from “Sayonara Japan” (1981, Futabasha), one from “Hansel and Gretel” (1981, Sony Magazines), two from “Her Thoughts...” (1990, Kodansha), and two from “SOS Daitokyo Tankentai” (1996, Kodansha). 

(1996, Kodansha).
The short story “DON QUIXOTE” was changed from the original version, in which the left and right sides of the koma were switched to open on the right, to this version, in which the koma are opened on the left from the end of the volume.

In addition, all short stories that were in color when first published in the magazine have been restored.

---
OTOMO THE COMPLETE WORKS Volume 6

biography.en:
**Name In Native Language:** 大友克洋

Ootomo Katsuhiro (born April 14, 1954) is a Japanese manga artist, screenwriter, animator, and film director. He, [Miyazaki Hayao](https://mangadex.org/author/6cdfb695-afc4-43af-bf76-20b2a4b37a7f), and [Mamoru Oshii](https://mangadex.org/author/1530ea1e-ba08-4dee-b2e6-a96b93849757) are together known as the “three giants of Japanese animation direction”.

In 1954, Otomo was born in Miyagi Prefecture. When he was young, he was deeply influenced by Tezuka's *Astro Boy* and *Jungle Emperor*, and determined to become a manga artist in middle school. In 1980, he began to serialize his famous work *Domu*, and in 1982, he began to serialize his most famous work *Akira*. In 1983, he began to participate in the production of animated films, and produced the animated film *Akira* based on his own manga in 1988, which achieved great success. Then his creative focus gradually shifted to animated films.

“A boy with extraordinary abilities stands on the ruins of Tokyo, and everyone will say that this is Katsuhiro Otomo.”
\-Miyazaki Hayao
